comp_anal_ht:
['Page 59:
[¬s]"One Way ANOVA was an appropriate analysis because the data consisted of one
dependent variable, Keystone Algebra Examination Scores obtained from two different
groups: 2011 pre-re-implemented dress code and 2013 post-re-implemented dress code.
There was one independent variable: the high-school student dress-code policy. The
researcher utilized Keystone Test scale scores because they best met the assumptions of
ANOVA.[¬e]"']

int_name_info: No specific name. Effects of school uniforms measured.
int_desc_info: 'Relying on data secured annually through EMIS for these eight districts...school performance measures were analyzed over time and compared to those schools that have implemented school uniform policies and those that have not, utilizing multiple modes of comparison.' (page 10)
int_objec_info: The study was carried out to discover the impact of school uniform policies on attendance, graduation rate, academic proficiency and suspensions (page 11)

int_desc_ht:
['Page 3:
[¬s]"LUSD has permitted its schools to require students to wear
uniforms since at least 1992.7 Initially, only a handful of schools
required uniforms. However, uniform adoption grew substantially
over the following 13 years. Of schools that responded to our
survey of uniform policies, which we describe in more detail
below, only 10% required uniforms in 1993. By 2006, 82% of these
schools required uniforms. In addition, no schools abandoned
uniforms after adoption. These characteristics suggest that parents
and school administrators in LUSD generally believe that uniforms
are helpful.[¬e]"']
int_objec_ht:
['Page 1:
[¬s]"Uniforms could improve student out- comes through a few mechanisms. First, they potentially provide di- rect improvements in safety by making it easy to identify unauthorized visitors to a school, preventing the use of gang colors and insignia, and reducing theft since students no longer bring expensive clothing items to school (Stanley, 1996)."
"Second, uniformsmay instill respect for authority in students which,
in turn, could improve behavior and reduce classroom disruptions.
Third, a concern for adolescents, particularly girls, is that there"
"Using a unique
dataset from a large urban school district in the southwest United States, we assess how uniforms affect
behavior, achievement and other outcomes[¬e]"', 'Page 2:
[¬s]"may be substantial peer pressure to dress well which could, in turn,
lead to low selfesteem if a child is unable to dress ‘‘properly’’ due to
low income or parental preferences. Uniforms negate much of this
peer pressure by requiring students to wear the same clothing.
Uniforms also make the process of dressing for school faster,
particularly for adolescent girls, potentially providing extra time
for sleeping or studying."
"Finally, uniforms provide an additional tool that administra-
tors and teachers can use for discipline by providing students with
rewards of ‘‘uniform-free’’ days for good behavior.[¬e]"']

comp_anal_ht:
['Page 3:
[¬s]"Since uniforms may have different impacts by gender and
grade level, we conduct all of our analyses separately for males
and females and for elementary (grades 1–5) and middle/high
school (6–12) grades as well as provide pooled estimates. Further,
we estimate variations on the model in Eq. (1) to look at different
effects by student race, economic status and achievement. In addi-
tion, we test whether uniform effects vary by student characteristics
given the student is in a school with other students like him or her –
i.e. does the effect on black students in a heavily black school differ
from black students in a heavily white and Hispanic school[¬e]"']

['Page 17:
[¬s]". In an attempt to address school
safety, rising gang violence, decreased attendance, increased discipline problems, and
decreasing academic scores uniform dress code has been implemented in all elementary
and middle schools in a South Texas Independent School District (ISD).[¬e]"']
int_prov_ht:
['Page 17:
[¬s]"There was a public high school in South Texas, hereafter referred to as The Public
High School (TPHS), in which a uniform dress code was implemented in the 2003-04
school year.[¬e]"']

sought to investigate what impact, if any, the uniform dress code policy had on student[¬e]"', 'Page 18:

TAKS test scores since its implementation at TPHS campus.[¬e]"']
int_dur_ht: ['Page 17:\n[¬s]"The uniform dress\ncode policy had been enforced for five years but had not been evaluated[¬e]"']
int_fidel_ht:
['Page 80:
[¬s]"Another theme that emerged was that there were problems with enforcing the
uniform dress code. An example was given by one of the teachers. Students would come
to her third period class out of dress code and for some reason or another they were not
caught. The teacher was now held responsible for writing the students up even though the
first period teacher neglected to do their job. This presented a dilemma for her, should
she write the student up or look the other way. The counselor also stated that he would
see a student in the hall out of dress code and escort that student to the office. Once there,
he would tell the student to have a seat and inform the secretary of what had happened
and then leave. He had no idea if there was anything done to the student or if the student
simply walked away. He also expressed concerns about what impact uniform dress code
had on incoming students from other schools in and outside of the district Some parents
did not have the money to get the uniforms right away, so they would either take their
children home or simply depend on the school to provide the uniforms. The counselor as
well as the principal's office had secured shirts for students through donations but they
were constantly running out.[¬e]"']

int_objec_info: To reduce distractions to students and improve academic attainment in Hispanic and African American students.
int_approach_info: There was no teaching of the intervention in this study. Only an implementation of dress code for the whole school.
int_who_info: No teaching in this intervention. School staff may have had to reinforce the dress code, however.
